Matrix Manipulation Module¶

lsi_matrix.count_all_words(matrix)[source]¶

This method counts all the words in the matrix.

Args:
matrix (numpy 2D array): matrix that contains words
Returns:
counter object that has the word count for all the words
lsi_matrix.count_student_words(words, blankdictionary)[source]¶

This method uses the blank dictionary as a reference. Update the values in the blank dictionary with regards to how much they occur in the words matrix.

Args:
words (numpy 2D array): word matrix blankdictionary (dict): contains the words we should be looking for
Returns:
dictionary with words from the blankdictionary with frequency updated
lsi_matrix.dict_to_array(dictionary)[source]¶

Converts a dictionary into an arrays

Args:
dictionary (dict): the dictionary to be converted
Returns:
array of words that are sorted by its value
lsi_matrix.get_essay_from_line(row)[source]¶

This method takes in a row from the answer log and extracts the essay submission in the line.

Args:
row (numpy array): array with different information from the anser log
Returns:
answer (str): student answer essay from this line
lsi_matrix.get_name_from_line(row)[source]¶

This method extracts the student ID from the row.

Args:
row (numpy array): row from the answer log
Returns:
string (str): ID that identifies the student
lsi_matrix.get_number_from_line(row)[source]¶

This method extracts the number from the row. Number is the question number in the quiz.

Args:
row (numpy array): row from the answer log
Returns:
string (str): question number extracted from the row
lsi_matrix.get_test_name_from_line(row)[source]¶

This method extracts the test name from the row.

Args:
row (numpy array): row from the answer log
Returns:
string (str): name of the quiz/test in this row
lsi_matrix.get_time_stamp_from_line(row)[source]¶

This method extracts the time stamp from the row.

Args:
row (numpy array): row from the answer log
Returns:
string (str): timestamp extracted from the row
lsi_matrix.has_time_stamp(string)[source]¶

This method checks if the row has a time stamp.

Args:
row (numpy array): row from the answer log
Returns:
answer (bool): returns True if there is a timestamp, False otherwise
lsi_matrix.read_answer_log(filename, quizname, numbers)[source]¶

This method reads data from an answer log. Each row is a student submission. This takes care of multiple submissions and only considers the latest submit.

Args:
filename (str): will be the name of the file. eg ‘answer_log’ quizename (str): name of the quiz to extract. eg ‘Lecture_6’ numbers (int): number that has the essay question in it, for now this is alway 1.
Returns:
matrix of the essay answers, each row is a
lsi_matrix.recreate_wordle_matrix(dictionary)[source]¶

This method uses the dictionary input to make a list of words with a word appearing so many times according to its value in the dictionary.

Args:
dictionary (dict): the dictionary to be read
Returns:
array of words
lsi_matrix.recreate_wordle_matrix_from_array(array)[source]¶

Converts an array of word:value into an array of words. The same as recreate_wordle_matrix() but here we have an array.

Args:
array (numpy array): the dictionary to be converted
Returns:
array of words with each word repeating so many times according to the array input
lsi_matrix.remove_duplicate_submits(matrix, quizname, numbers)[source]¶

This method is used by read_answer_log().

This ensures that the last submitted answer from a student is the one we extract

Args:
matrix (numpy 2D array): matrix that contains the answer log data quizname (str): quize name we are currently searching for numbers (int): currently set at 1
Returns:
matrix without any duplicate submissions
lsi_matrix.set_dict_values_to_zero(dictionary)[source]¶

This method sets all the values of a dictionary to 0.

Args:
dictionary (dict): the dictionary to be reset
Returns:
dictionary with words as keys and values set to 0.
lsi_matrix.set_minimum(dictionary, minimum)[source]¶

Filter out elements that do not make the minimum value.

Args:
dictionary (dict): the dictionary to be checked for values minimum (int): minimum value
Returns:
dictionary with all its elements having values greater than minimum
lsi_matrix.set_threshold(matrix, dictionary, minimum)[source]¶

TODO: currently not using this

Args:
array (numpy array): the dictionary to be converted
Returns:
array of words with each word repeating so many times according to the array input
lsi_matrix.sort_by_key(unsorted)[source]¶

This method sorts a dictionary by its key.

Args:
unsorted (dict): the dictionary to be sorted
Returns:
sorted tuple
lsi_matrix.sort_by_value(unsorted)[source]¶

This method sorts a dictionary by its value.

Args:
unsorted (dict): the dictionary to be sorted
Returns:
sorted tuple
lsi_matrix.word_matrix(student_comment_matrix, dictionary)[source]¶

This method turns a word matrix into a frequency matrix. A matrix of words into numbers that represent frequency.

Args:
student_comment_matrix (numpy 2D array): student essay matrix dictionary (dict): blank dictionary of words that are relevant
Returns:
frequency matrix
